column1: instruction
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Lightly grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking sodaa and salt
In a separate bowl, cream together butter and brown sugar
Stir in eggs and mashed banana until well blended
Stir banana mixture into flour mixture; stir just to moisten
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan
Bake in preheated oven for 60 to 65 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into center of the loaf comes out clean
Let bread cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Lightly grease 10 muffin cups, or line with muffin papers
In a large bowl, mix together 1 1/2 cups flour, baking sodaa, baking powder and salt
In another bowl, beat together banana, sugar, egg and melted butter
Stir the banana mixture into the flour mixture just until moistened
Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups
In a small bowl, mix together brown sugar, 2 tablespoons flour and cinnamon
Cut in 1 tablespoon butter until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal
Sprinkle topping over muffins
Bake in preheated oven for 18 to 20 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into center of a muffin comes out clean
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Melt the butter in a saucepan
Stir in flour to form a paste
Add water, white sugar and brown sugar, and bring to a boil
Reduce temperature and let simmer
Place the bottom crust in your pan
Fill with apples, mounded slightly
Cover with a lattice work crust
Gently pour the sugar and butter liquid over the crust
Pour slowly so that it does not run off
Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven
Reduce the temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Continue baking for 35 to 45 minutes, until apples are soft
